results.headline: Review: In ‘These Final Hours’ an Imminent Apocalypse Incites Depravity
results.summary_short: In this Australian drama by Zak Hilditch, a man is conflicted about how to spend his waning moments alive.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of These Final Hours

results.headline: Review: ‘Earth’s Golden Playground,’ a Documentary on Prospecting in the Yukon
results.summary_short: This film removes any luster from prospecting in the Canada territory where the Klondike gold rush took place more than a century ago.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Earth's Golden Playground

results.headline: Review: ‘Deli Man’ Is a Documentary on Jewish Delis, Schmaltz and All
results.summary_short: Through the experiences of a third-generation deli owner, this film touches on the history of delis in New York and sits down to a full table of discussion on the topic.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Deli Man

results.headline: Review: In ‘Chappie,’ a Smart Robot Runs With the Wrong Crowd
results.summary_short: The latest film from the director of “District 9” and “Elysium” is set in the usual bummer future and wavers uncertainly between laughter and tears.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Chappie

results.headline: Review: Adam Carolla’s ‘Road Hard,’ a Comedy About a Comic
results.summary_short: A stand-up comedian struggles to escape a rut of his own making.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Road Hard

results.headline: Review: ‘The Lesson’ Is a Test of Conscience and Patience
results.summary_short: This Bulgarian film, written and directed by Kristina Grozeva and Petar Valchanov, follows an English teacher as her carefully organized life comes undone.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Urok

results.headline: Review: ‘Around the World in 50 Concerts,’ a Documentary, Follows an Orchestra
results.summary_short: Heddy Honigmann’s film looks at the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra on its 125th anniversary tour in 2013.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Around the World in 50 Concerts

results.headline: Review: In ‘Futuro Beach,’ a Haunted Lifeguard Searches for Peace
results.summary_short: This elliptical gay romance by the Brazilian writer and director Karim Aïnouz follows its heroes from the warmly golden beach of the title to the cool dampness of Berlin.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Praia do Futuro

results.headline: Review: In ‘Eastern Boys,’ a Train-Station Pickup Gone Wrong
results.summary_short: Robin Campillo’s film stars Olivier Rabourdin as a French businessman and Kirill Emelyanov as the young man who turns an assignation into a home invasion.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eastern Boys

results.headline: Review: In ‘Bluebird,’ Momentary Distraction Sets Off a Chain of Misery
results.summary_short: In this film set in a Maine logging town, a school-bus driver deals with the repercussions of a tragic mistake.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bluebird

results.headline: Review: In ‘ ’71,’ Young, Green and Behind Enemy Lines
results.summary_short: In Belfast, 1971 was an eventful year of demands and bloodshed, and it was not always clear who was the enemy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of '71

results.headline: Review: ‘Young Bodies Heal Quickly’ Follows Brothers on the Run
results.summary_short: Andrew T. Betzer’s debut feature joins a Mutt-and-Jeff pair of brothers on the lam as they ping-pong around the Maryland countryside.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Widowmaker,’ a Heart Care Documentary
results.summary_short: Patrick Forbes’s film looks at doctors’ treatment recommendations after heart attacks, comparing the coronary calcium scan with the more expensive, more frequently used surgically implanted stent.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Widowmaker

results.headline: Review: ‘The Hunting Ground’ Documentary, a Searing Look at Campus Rape
results.summary_short: The director Kirby Dick and the producer Amy Ziering examine sexual violence at colleges and the failure of schools to seek justice for victims.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Hunting Ground

results.headline: Review: ‘Out of the Dark,’ With Julia Stiles and Scott Speedman
results.summary_short: In this film, a young London family moves to Bogotá only to be vexed by the supernatural and the disappearance of a daughter.

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Salvation,’ a Hero Lays Waste, Western Style (Danish, Too)
results.summary_short: Kristian Levring’s blood-soaked tale of an immigrant farmer’s showdown with a gang leader has all the classic touches of the genre.

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Lazarus Effect,’ Young Scientists Play God
results.summary_short: Olivia Wilde stars as a researcher brought back from the dead in David Gelb’s horror thriller.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Focus,’ a Grifter (Will Smith) as Life Coach
results.summary_short: Mr. Smith plays a seasoned con man who schools a novice (Margot Robbie) in more sophisticated scams.

results.headline: Review: David Cronenberg Dissects Hollywood in ‘Maps to the Stars’
results.summary_short: The film imagines Los Angeles as an inferno of narcissism, greed and sexual perversity.

results.headline: Review: ‘Wild Canaries’: Love, Death and Suspicious Minds
results.summary_short: In this caper by Lawrence Michael Levine, a young Brooklyn couple suspect the worst after a neighbor is found dead.
